module.title: uimhir
module.p:
uimhir is a non-declinable feminine generic quantity noun. Like uiread, it has two main senses –
resultative so much/many that, such a lot that eg. Tha uimhir chon aig Màiri is gu bheil i daonnan sgìth Mary has so many dogs that she’s always tired.
equative comparative as much/many as eg. Tha uimhir chon aig Màiri is a tha cait aig Dòmhnall. Mary has as many dogs as Donald has cats.
In terms of the stuff being quantified (ie. the standard of comparison), uimhir generally works like other generic quantity nouns –

ul.li:
When the standard of comparison is new information, it is usually expressed as a noun modifier/specifier of the quantity noun, either the genitive singular of a mass noun or the genitive plural of a count noun eg.
Dh’òl Raonaid uimhir fìona ... Rachel drank so/as much wine ...
Tha uimhir chon aig Màiri ... Mary has so/as many dogs ...
td. 616
td. 616

When the standard of comparison is already known, it is usually introduced by the partitive preposition de of governing a specified (ie. ‘definite’) noun eg.
Dh’òl Raonaid uimhir den fhìona ... Rachel drank so/as much of the wine ...
Cheannaich Màiri uimhir de mo choin ... Mary bought so/as many of my dogs ...

When the standard of comparison is already known, and has just been referred to, or can be inferred, uimhir can occur on its own eg.
Dh’òl Raonaid uimhir ... Rachel drank so/as much ...
Tha uimhir aig Màiri ... Mary has so/as many ...
Dè uimhir ’s a th’ ann?
How much is there? td. 396
Thoir dhomh uimhir eile.
Give me as much again/the same again. td. 396
Na toir dhomh uimhir ri Seumas!
Don’t give me as much as James! td. 396

Alternatively, uimhir can be followed by one of the de prepositional pronouns eg.
Dh’òl Raonaid uimhir dheth ... Rachel drank so/as much of it ...
Tha uimhir dhiubh aig Màiri ... Mary has so/as many of them ...
Mark (2004) td. 615

uimhir mu (dheidhinn) so/as much [information/knowledge] about some topic eg.
Dh’ionnsaich Màiri uimhir mu choin ... Mary learned so much about dogs.
td. 60

uimhir ri (dhèanamh) so/as much to do eg.
Tha uimhir ri dhèanamh aig Raonaid ... Rachel has so/as much to do ...
Mark (2004) td. 615

module.p:
However, there is some variation in usage to be found here.
Bha uimhir de dhaoine ann.
There were so many / such a lot of people there. td. 396
Bha uimhir de dh’airgead agam.
I had so much / such a lot of money. td. 396
Mark (2004) td. 616
